labels.analysis: The MCP Server focuses on providing a rich library of UI components, special effects, animations, and device mocks specifically designed for enhancing user interface development. Its tools cater to developers and designers by offering detailed implementation information for pre-built UI elements, categorized for easy retrieval and integration. The server's primary purpose is to simplify and streamline the UI creation process by offering a comprehensive collection of interactive and visually appealing components.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Content Creation" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around providing tools for creating and enhancing UI elements, which directly supports the process of UI/UX designâ€”a subset of content creation. The secondary label "Development Tools" is included because the server provides implementation details and components that are directly useful for developers. A custom label "UI Design Components" is added to highlight the server's unique focus on providing a vast library of UI-specific elements and animations.

tools.name: getUIComponents
tools.description: Provides a comprehensive list of all Magic UI components.

tools.name: getLayout
tools.description: Provides implementation details for bento-grid, dock, file-tree, grid-pattern, interactive-grid-pattern, dot-pattern components.

tools.name: getMedia
tools.description: Provides implementation details for hero-video-dialog, terminal, marquee, script-copy-btn, code-comparison components.

tools.name: getMotion
tools.description: Provides implementation details for blur-fade, scroll-progress, scroll-based-velocity, orbiting-circles, animated-circular-progress-bar components.

tools.name: getTextReveal
tools.description: Provides implementation details for text-animate, line-shadow-text, aurora-text, animated-shiny-text, animated-gradient-text, text-reveal, typing-animation, box-reveal, number-ticker components.

tools.name: getTextEffects
tools.description: Provides implementation details for word-rotate, flip-text, hyper-text, morphing-text, spinning-text, sparkles-text components.

tools.name: getButtons
tools.description: Provides implementation details for rainbow-button, shimmer-button, shiny-button, interactive-hover-button, animated-subscribe-button, pulsating-button, ripple-button components.

tools.name: getEffects
tools.description: Provides implementation details for animated-beam, border-beam, shine-border, magic-card, meteors, neon-gradient-card, confetti, particles, cool-mode, scratch-to-reveal components.

tools.name: getWidgets
tools.description: Provides implementation details for animated-list, tweet-card, client-tweet-card, lens, pointer, avatar-circles, icon-cloud, globe components.

tools.name: getBackgrounds
tools.description: Provides implementation details for warp-background, flickering-grid, animated-grid-pattern, retro-grid, ripple components.

tools.name: getDevices
tools.description: Provides implementation details for safari, iphone-15-pro, android components.

server_info_crawled.name: Magic UI Component Server
server_info_crawled.author: @magicuidesign/mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide comprehensive Magic UI components, device mocks, special effects, animations, text animations, buttons, and backgrounds to enhance your UI development. Enable seamless integration with various MCP clients to access detailed implementation information for a wide range of UI elements. Simplify UI creation by leveraging categorized tools for efficient component retrieval and usage.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@magicuidesign/mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
